intro: Stylidium ericksoniae, commonly known as the yellow stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow, sticky flowers that are adapted for insect pollination. The plant has a compact growth habit with fleshy, ribbed stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its unique floral structure includes a modified calyx that functions as a nectar guide, attracting specific pollinators. Stylidium ericksoniae is an example of a halophytic species, capable of thriving in saline soils.
